status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #4613: ARROW-5054: [Release][Flight] Test Flight in release verification scripts
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4613
 
 
   To make testing a bit easier, I also moved the test functions to a separate bash script and added a test-release-verification.sh script so it is easier to test bits without having to simulate 02-source.sh
   
   This currently fails on the TLS Python test, so this will need to be debugged a bit further once that's sorted out
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

kou commented on issue #4613: ARROW-5054: [Release][Flight] Test Flight in release verification scripts
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4613#issuecomment-503834713
 
 
   I don't want to split the verification script.
   It may cause "`test-release-verification.sh" works but `verify-release-candidate.sh` doesn't work" because of poor modularity feature of shell such as no namespace and easy to use global variables.
   I like `TARBALL=/path/to/apache-arrow.tar.gz dev/release/verify-release-candidate.sh source ...` with:
   
   ```shell
   if [ -z "${TARBALL:-}" ]; then
     fetch_archive ...
   else
     tar xf ${TARBALL}
   fi
   ```
   
   And we need some work for GLib. We can't use `configure` with archive created by `git archive`.
   
   Can I take over this?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #4613: ARROW-5054: [Release][Flight] Test Flight in Linux/macOS release verification scripts
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4613#issuecomment-505204480
 
 
    I've tested the followings:
   
     * `TEST_DEFAULT=0 TEST_INTEGRATION=1`
     * `TEST_DEFAULT=0 TEST_RUST=1`
     * `TEST_DEFAULT=0 TEST_GO=1`
     * `TEST_DEFAULT=0 TEST_RUBY=1`
   
   They cover all source verification.
